column4: Hi, how do I change DNS in network manager with DSL connection?
I tried changing resolve.conf but it doesnt seem to work
adjust /etc/dhcp3/dhclient.conf
I added opendns in prepend n removed domain-name-server from request
you have to reconnect or rerun dhclient
whats in /etc/resolv.conf your opendns server?
prepend domain-name-servers 208.67.222.222,208.67.220.220;
right did those two server show up in /etc/resolv.conf?
http://paste.ubuntu.com/124147/
thats your resolv.conf?
no, the resolv.conf still has the old server names
try putting domain-name-servers back in request
thats my dhclient.conf
right, put domain-name-servers back in request. how do you connect to dsl? using networkmanager?
I put that back n reconnected. resolv.conf still has old DNS
try removing one dns server from prepend line, cause im not sure what the separator between them should be?
are u using network manager to connect?
yes I use network manager,
changed permission of resolv.conf, the nameserver goes blank, still connected with old DNS
im not sure whats going on there sorry. :(
OK, thanks. I will try with wicd
